page.title: 13HOUSES
page.content: Most of the older houses are built from coursed stone with stone flagged roofs. Often they have mullion windows and many weavers cottages have a row of mullion windows upstairs to let in the maximum light. Most recent houses are built of random stone and they have bigger windows,and the roofs are slate or concrete tiles. Few houses are built of other materials. Terraced houses are the most common in the hamlets of Victoria,Jackson Bridge and Barnside and also on Lee Terrace in Scholes. Often the houses in this area have more than two storeys being built into the hillside with one dwelling above and one below.Hepworth has many traditional older houses typical of our area,but there are new houses and bungalows on the outskirts. Nearly all the houses are private,but Hepworth has a small council estate.
